title.narrative: Early Intervention Hearing Impairment East Java

description.narrative: The Western Australian Disability Services Commission, through the partnership agreement with the East Java Hearing and Communication Center, contributes to the development of capacity in East Java to meet the needs of children with hearing impairments. The project forms part The Patricia O'Sullivan Humanitarian Project (POSH) coordinates initiatives in East Java and is currently working with the East Java Provincial Government on a pilot early intervention program to detect hearing disorders in children 0-6 months across 4 provinces, and the training of audiologists and speech therapists to help meet the huge need for hearing services in East Java. Funding also supported a group of 10 nurses and teachers from the Indonesian province to receive training in audiology testing for the early detection of hearing deficits and communication skills for deaf education.
